body:
#### Overview of the Issue

(credit to @zmagg for the initial writeup that is ~reproduced here)

When a tablet completes creating a backup it returns to a `SERVING` state without consideration of accrued replication lag. If this value larger than you're comfortable serving in then there is a period of time between completing the backup and detecting a tablet in this unhealthy state where you're serving stale data.

The fallout is unnecessarily noisy alerts and potentially serving bad data.

#### Reproduction Steps

Roughly:

1. Begin backup that takes a non trivial period of time
2. Master receives enough writes that replication is slow
3. Observe tablet serving queries during replication while lag > an unhealthy threshold
4. Healthchecks notice unhealthy state and tablet stops serving queries

#### Log Fragments

```
15:00:54.948165 tabletserver.go:312] TabletServer state: NOT_SERVING (Not Connected) -> NOT_SERVING (Transitioning)
15:00:54.970844 engine.go:183] Time taken to load the schema: 1.053µs
15:00:54.973905 tabletserver.go:312] TabletServer state: NOT_SERVING (Transitioning) -> SERVING
15:00:54.973935 updatestreamctl.go:213] Enabling update stream, dbname: vt_byteam
15:00:54.973985 state_change.go:154] Done with post-action state refresh
15:00:54.975066 rpc_server.go:93] TabletManager.Backup(concurrency:4 )(on us_east_1-0100125104 from ): <nil>
15:00:55.977517 healthcheck.go:269] Disabling query service because of health-check failure: reported replication lag: 3049 higher than unhealthy threshold: 300
15:00:55.977543 tabletserver.go:312] TabletServer state: SERVING -> SHUTTING_DOWN (Shutting Down)
```

#### Suggested Fix

Tablets will transition into `NOT_SERVING` once completing a backup and we'll let health checks determine that it's safe to move them into a serving state when lag < healthy threshold.
title: Tablets serving stale data after backup
